technology.short_description: Skink warriors are lightly armoured and best-used for skirmish duties in battle.

effects.description: Ammunition: +15% for all Skink infantry units
Melee attack: +4 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Missile strength: +15% for Skink, Chameleon Skink and Chameleon Stalker units

technology.short_description: By the application of natural sap, the armoured bulk of the Kroxigors can be further strengthened so they survive longer in battle.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Kroxigors and Sacred Kroxigors units
Melee defence: +4 for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Chameleon Stalker and Red Crested Skink units

technology.short_description: Each spawning of Skink or Kroxigor act as one on the battlefield, acting in a perfectly coordinated manner to crush the enemies of the Old Ones.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Skink units
Weapon strength: +10% for Kroxigors units

technology.short_description: A near-constant state of war should not prevent the construction or management of the temple-cities.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Saurus units
Weapon strength: +10% for Temple Guards units

technology.short_description: Gold, found in abundance in Lustria, is used to fashion exquisite armour to cover those parts the Lizardmen's tough scales do not.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Temple Guards units
Armour: +10 for Saurus units

technology.short_description: The most respected of all Saurus Warriors, the Temple Guard are equipped with the finest arms and armour available.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Saurus units
Melee defence: +4 for Temple Guards units

technology.short_description: The following item advances the Great Plan concerning Lizardmen craft.

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +10%

technology.short_description: The following item advances the Great Plan concerning Lizardmen monuments.

effects.description: Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
Global recruitment capacity: +1

effects.description: Corruption: -2

effects.description: Enemy Hero action success chance: -5%
Enemy Hero action success chance: -5%

Upkeep: -5% for Skink units
Speed: +10% for Skink, Chameleon Skink and Red Crested Skink units
Charge bonus: +5 for Kroxigors units

technology.short_description: Once new temple-cities are fully connected to the Geomantic Web, future Skink and Kroxigor spawnings will be enhanced.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -20% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Physical resistance: 5% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Recruitment cost: -20% for Skink and Chameleon Skinks units
Leadership: +4 for Skink, Chameleon Skink and Red Crested Skink units

Alignments gained from battles: +5%

technology.short_description: The following item advances the Great Plan concerning Saurus.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% for Saurus and Temple Guard units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Saurus and Temple Guards units

technology.short_description: These directions ensure sufficient numbers of beast-sensitives among Skink and Saurus spawnings.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Saurus and Temple Guards units (Rank 7 and above)
Spell resistance: 10% for Saurus and Temple Guards units (Rank 7 and above)
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Saurus and Temple Guards units (minimum 1)
Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for Saurus and Temple Guards units (minimum 1)

technology.short_description: The skinks scamper about, comparing reports and funnelling supplies from location to location.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5%
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: Every plaza, every ziggurat, every stone - each element must be laid out exactly as the Old Ones decreed.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: The wisest race is indifferent to pain and fortune's many vicissitudes.

effects.description: Control: +2

technology.short_description: The lesser races will never know all the Lizardmen do for them, but they stand firm none the less.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 5% when defending

technology.short_description: The ancient technology of the Old Ones is poorly understood... and powerful beyond comprehension.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn
Miscast base chance: -2%

technology.short_description: Some of the more powerful Slann are capable of bestowing magical enchantments on an entire force at once.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +10% for armies
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

Enables magical attacks
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)
Miscast base chance: -2%

technology.short_description: It is our sacred charge to enact the Great Plan and stop the ruination of Chaos. The teachings the Old Ones provide the tools to do so.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -2%
Immune to Chaos Undivided corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition

Passive ability: "Recovery"
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: With mastery of Ghyran we can bring our warriors back from the brink of death.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -2%

Army ability: "Geomantic Healing"
	(all armies)

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: Of the myriad jungle plants, some are poisonous while others stimulate and rejuvenate the Skinks.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Upkeep: -10% for Skink units
Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for Skink, Kroxigors and Sacred Kroxigors units (minimum 1)

technology.short_description: The above-ground spawning pools must be prepared; new Skinks will be required if the Plan is to be interpreted on schedule.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Skink units
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Kroxigors and Sacred Kroxigors units

technology.short_description: Whereby Skinks and Kroxigors are trained for battle, focusing on use of their natural agility and strength respectively to damage the foe.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Kroxigors units
Recruit rank: +2 for Skink units

technology.short_description: The Temple Guard, veterans all and many thousands of years old, are a pinnacle to which all Saurus aspire.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Saurus units
Recruit rank: +2 for Temple Guards units

technology.short_description: Those spawning pools located underground must be ready - war is always at hand and fresh Saurus will be needed to fight.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Saurus and Temple Guards units

technology.short_description: Of the myriad jungle plants, some are poisonous while others stimulate and rejuvenate the Saurus.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Temple Guards units
Upkeep: -10% for Saurus units

technology.short_description: Every lost plaque and idol has its place in the Great Plan.

effects.description: Income from sacking settlements: +25%

technology.short_description: Lizardmen Temple-Cities were once the most magnificent structures in the world. And they shall be again.

effects.description: Construction cost: -40% for resource-producing buildings
Construction time: -1 for resource-producing buildings

technology.short_description: Our population is growing for the first time in millenia. The Great Plan calls for the seeding of new spawning pools.

effects.description: Growth: +25

technology.short_description: The Lizardmen's peerless warrior caste knows not hesitation, fear, or doubt.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when in own territory

technology.short_description: The Lizardmen have been here since the very beginning of the world, quite literally. Their command of magic is ancient and foreign.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -2%
Casualty replenishment rate: +25% for all Slann

technology.short_description: The riders harass and distract enemy missile troops in battle.

effects.description: All enemies have lowered missile weapon range by -25%% during battles

technology.short_description: Sneaky skinks sneakily slink into the enemy backlines and sabotage their arms and armour.

effects.description: All enemies have lowered armour by -5% during battles

technology.short_description: With the right tools, the crude designs of the warmbloods can be broken down and repurposed.

effects.description: Income from looting settlements: +50%

technology.short_description: The revered Old Ones must be venerated whenever possible.

effects.description: Construction cost: -20% for Cult of Sotek and Cult of the Old Ones buildings
Construction time: -1 for Cult of Sotek and Cult of the Old Ones buildings

technology.short_description: Only those among the younger races whose existence adheres to the tenets of the Great Plan are permitted.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with High Elves
Diplomatic relations: +50 with Lizardmen

technology.short_description: Those who venerate the architects of the ceasless Doomtide must be utterly destroyed.

effects.description: Chance of a plague spreading: -25%
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Skaven
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

technology.short_description: In times of trouble the Lizardmen can turn inward both for protection and to conserve.

effects.description: Defensive supplies: +1000
Spell resistance: 10% when under siege
Attrition: -10% when under siege
Miscast base chance: -2%

technology.short_description: Tepok the Inscrutable's blessing shall wash all blight upon this land.

effects.description:
Corruption: -2
	(all characters factionwide)
Miscast base chance: -2%

technology.short_description: With concentration and our most powerful artifacts, Lizardmen spellcasters prove they are without peer.

effects.description:
Cooldown: -20% to all spells
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)
Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells
Miscast base chance: -2%

technology.short_description: The ground is perforated with poisoned javelins; the enemy must move slowly to avoid impaling themselves.

effects.description: All enemies have lowered speed by -15%% during battles

technology.short_description: The sound is constant, omnipresent, and terrifying.

effects.description: All enemies have lowered melee weapon damage by -10%% during battles

technology.short_description: The warmbloods lust for our gold - the Great Plan authorizes exchanges if it suits it's furthering.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +10%
Tradable resources produced: +10%

technology.short_description: Within the Star Chambers, the Slann meditate and plan the future of their race.

effects.description: Construction cost: -20% for Star Chamber buildings
Construction time: -1 for Star Chamber buildings

technology.short_description: The ability to remain hidden almost anywhere is vital if the foe's intrigues are to be discovered and frustrated.

effects.description: Casualties captured post-battle: +25%
Campaign line of sight: +25%

technology.short_description: The oldest amongst the Lizardmen have been called to the training fields to educate the young.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +2 for all Heroes

technology.short_description: Lizardmen warriors do not fight for gold or fame, but to enact the will of the Old Ones themselves.

effects.description: Lord recruitment cost: -25%
Hero recruitment cost: -25%
Hero and Lord recruit rank: +1

technology.short_description: The Lizardmen will never flee nor break, every obstacle that stands in the way of the Great Plan will be razed to the ground.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10
	(all characters factionwide)
Hero and Lord recruit rank: +1

Passive ability: "Bolstered Leadership"
	(all characters factionwide)

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: Lizardmen movements are fluid and decisive, descending upon every foe with terrifying purpose.

effects.description: Hero and Lord recruit rank: +1

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +50
	(all characters factionwide)

Attribute: Strider
	(all characters factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 10% when defending
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: The trinkets and baubles that adorn the Lizardmen are not mere decoration.

effects.description: Hero and Lord recruit rank: +1

Passive ability: "Obsinite Plate"
	(all characters factionwide)
Melee and missile weapon damage: +10% for Blessed units

technology.short_description: The most irregular weapons are reserved for Terradon and Ripperdactyl Riders, who are armed with poison-tipped javelins, fireleech bolas, and various other unusual ordnances.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Terradon Riders units
Missile strength: +10% for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Melee attack: +4 for Cold One, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units

technology.short_description: Not all that lives within the jungle can be spotted through the dense foliage. Some will kill their quarry without ever being seen.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Cold One, Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, Coatl, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Physical resistance: 5% for Cold One, Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, Coatl, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units

technology.short_description: The bond between beast and rider must not be underestimated.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units
Speed: +20% for Cold One units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units

technology.short_description: Instincts are ingrained over millennia of fierce combat.

effects.description: Defence: +4 for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon, Ancient Salamander and Dread Saurian units

technology.onscreen_name: Sequence of the Great Beast's Rampage
technology.short_description: It's best to stay out of a Great Beast's way if you don't want to be trampled or gored, no matter whose side you are on.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for Stegadon, Feral Troglodon, Ancient Salamander and Bastiladon units
Charge bonus: +20 for Feral Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units
Missile strength: +5% for Stegadon, Feral Troglodon, Ancient Salamander and Bastiladon units
Leadership: +4 for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Troglodon, and Ancient Salamander units

technology.onscreen_name: Sequence of the Great Beast's Strength
technology.short_description: Sharpened teeth and metal adornments. The most terrifying beasts in Lustria are cared for in ways to be ever more imposing.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Feral Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units
Missile resistance: 10% for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Troglodon, and Ancient Salamander units

technology.short_description: A strict schedule from which the Skinks work to ensure the Great Plan is carried out.

effects.description: Income from Industry: +10%

technology.short_description: Although the sea is not generally their habitat, amphibious Lizardmen are used to traverse the hazardous waters when the need arises.

effects.description: Construction cost: -20% for Ports
Construction time: -1 for Ports

technology.short_description: Lizardmen do not tire easily - this sequence ensures that all Saurus spawnings have the required stamina.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10% for armies

technology.short_description: By which the Old Ones' agents may be guided remotely, greatly increasing their chances of success.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +10%

technology.short_description: Perfect mental imprinting and limitless discipline create some of the most effective commanders in the world.

effects.description: Hero and Lord recruit rank: +1
Upkeep: -10% for Lords and Heroes

technology.short_description: Once the foe's blood begins to flow the Beasts go into a near-uncontrollable frenzy.

technology.short_description: Fresh quadruped 'recruits' are always required when war comes to Lustria's jungle shores.

technology.short_description: As LizardmenTemple-Cities expand, the skink attendants must work harder and, more importantly, better.

effects.description: Income from Cities: +25%

technology.short_description: Understanding of the Great Plan involves the realisation that others have a role to play.

effects.description: Construction cost: -40% for Landmark buildings

technology.short_description: The deeper Lizardmen scry into the past the more wondrous their powers become.

effects.description: Wound recovery time: -2

technology.short_description: Implementing intense, regimented running drills has remarkable effects on even our mightiest champions.

	(all characters factionwide)

	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: Education, both mental and martial, should be ceaseless.

	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: The Winds infuse our greatest heroes with vitality and confidence.

effects.description:
Hit points: +5%
	(all characters factionwide)

Removes Cause Fear from all enemies

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

technology.short_description: The Children of the Gods loyally obey the commands of the Old Ones. They have built their cities precisely where they are meant to be.

effects.description: Reinforces the Geomantic Web to level 3, indirectly improving commandments

technology.short_description: By providing for the Great Beasts, their brethren are more and more willing to flock to our cause.
